x-sap-shortText: Email reporting related API endpoint. It is used to collect and analyze delivery parameters for a specific contact.

info.title: SAP Emarsys Core - Delivery Results
info.description: This endpoint allows you to analyze all your delivery parameters for a specific contact, including the status, the date of the campaign as well as its campaign ID.

host.description: This is the default Emarsys API server.

externalDocs.description: For more information, please visit our official SAP Emarsys developer portal.

get.description:
The endpoint returns the delivery results of a specific contact in the given interval.

> **IMPORTANT:**
> 
> - Please note that the interval covered by `startDate` and `endDate` cannot be longer than 90 days.
>
> - A rate limit of 1000 requests per minute per API user applies combined for the endpoints under the api/email/reporting/v1 subdomain.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date of the searched interval in ISO-8601 format.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date of the searched interval in ISO-8601 format.

Parameter startDate must be ISO-8601.description: The parameter startDate must be in ISO-8601 format.

error.message: The parameter startDate must be in ISO-8601 format.

Parameter endDate must be ISO-8601.description: The parameter endDate must be ISO-8601.

error.message: The parameter endDate must be ISO-8601.

Start and end date must be in 90 days in.description: Start and end date must be in 90 days interval.

error.message: Start and end date must be in 90 days interval.

Parameter contact id must be integer.description: The parameter contact id must be integer.

error.message: The parameter contact id must be integer.

500.description: Indicates that the request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed. The location to check the status of the request should be returned in the response.

deliveryStatus.description: The result can contain the following status: SOFT_BOUNCED, HARD_BOUNCED, BLOCK_BOUNCED, CANCELED, LAUNCHED.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description: To use this API, you must first obtain an OAuth 2.0 client credentials token. After that you can use the token to call the API. For more information, see [Authentication](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/branches/OAuth-2.0/b3c3a1eba8515-authentication-in-v3-api).
